job description:
ROLE SUMMARY

+ Ensure compliance in a lab animal and preclinical GLP setting. Interact with internal and external regulatory bodies including Environmental Health & Safety, Occupational Health & Wellness, internal audits, United States Department of Agriculture, Food & Drug Administration, and AAALACi. Serve as author and subject matter expert on Standard Operating Procedures, documentation management/archiving, and quality control ranging from scientific study data to supplies

+ **ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES**

+ Create, implement and maintain all SOP's and documentation including CM document management and record retention processes including SOPs, QC review, and deviations and serve as primary CM archivist.

+ Work proactively with DSRD Study Directors and staff to understand scientific studies and achieve GLP compliance at every level, minimize deviations, and resolve documentation issues in a complex, safety study environment with rodent and non-rodent species.

+ Interact during external regulatory inspections and site visits (ex: FDA, AAALAC International, USDA) as well as internal corporate and safety audits.

+ Serve as primary contact for MQA for facility and process audits for GLP compliance and work with Regulatory Compliance Lead, Operations Managers, CM SLT, and customer lines for audit resolution and to develop, enhance and promote compliance initiatives and improvement projects.

+ Maintain rigorous understanding of safety regulations and internal safety policies and develop processes for compliance with site wide and departmental safety initiatives.

+ Serve as back up for IACUC functions such as protocol management, facility inspections, semi-annual program reviews and/or Post-Approval Monitoring program when appropriate, and contribute to IACUC initiatives by devising and reviewing local and global IACUC policies

+ **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**

+ MS in related field required

+ CPIA required

+ In general, a colleague at this level will have a minimum 5-7 years of experience in a laboratory animal setting including 3-5 years regulatory experience.

+ Expertise in research compliance including in a GLP pharmaceutical setting required.

+ Requires a n understanding of animal facility operations and study conduct.
  • *PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
+ Additional certifications including PMP highly preferred.

+ Project management experience preferred.

+ Must have functional knowledge of Microsoft Office, Outlook, calendar management and Internet Explorer. Colleague should be skilled at advanced capabilities in Excel and other programs such as MS Projects, Spotfire, and other reporting tools and databases.
